data.question: What is the empirical formula of (S,S,S)-2?
What changes in crystal morphology are observed when converting (S,S,S)-2 to P-3?
data.answer: The morphology changes from cubes to rods.

data.question: Is the process of converting between (S,S,S)-2 and P-3 reversible?
What is the role of methanol in the synthesis of P-3?
data.answer: Methanol acts as an axial ligand to the Cu ion in the helical polymer P-3.

data.question: Can the conversion between (S,S,S)-2 and P-3 be easily followed and confirmed by PXRD?
What is the yield of (S)-H41 from its synthesis?
Does the crystal structure of (S,S,S)-2 include guest pyridine molecules?
What is the coordination geometry of the Cu ions in (S,S,S)-2?
What is the pitch of the helical structure in P-3?
Is the helical polymer P-3 homochiral?
What is the formula weight of P-3?
What solvent is used to convert P-3 back to (S,S,S)-2?
Is the axial ligand in the connecting metal centers of (S,S,S)-2 and P-3 the same?
What is the crystal system of P-3?
Does the conversion between (S,S,S)-2 and P-3 involve breaking and reforming of Cu−carboxylate interactions?
What is the role of pyridine in the synthesis of (S,S,S)-2?
data.answer: Pyridine acts as a solvent and coordinates to the Cu centers in the triangular macrocycle.

data.question: Are the guest molecules in P-3 helically aligned along the channel?
What is the volume of solvent accessible voids in the crystal of P-3?
What is the yield of the triangular macrocycle (S,S,S)-2 via path-a?
Is the formation of helical P-3 from (S,S,S)-2 a spontaneous process?
